sentences.cn: 看得出来，阿曼达紧张不安。

sentences.en: An agitated Norma is on the phone impatiently listening to the rings.
sentences.cn: 神色紧张的诺玛在打电话,焦急地听着对方铃响.

sentences.en: Because he's very easily agitated at work.
sentences.cn: 因为他在工作时常常发火.

sentences.en: Calm down! Don't get so agitated.
His answers were all mixed up, so agitated was he.
sentences.cn: 他是那样心神不定,回答全乱了.

sentences.en: His fiery speech agitated the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他热情洋溢的讲话激动了群众.

sentences.en: His threats become more intense, agitated, and frequent.
sentences.cn: 他发出的威胁更显言辞激烈、焦虑不安，也更为频繁。

sentences.en: Its molecules can be agitated by microwave energy.
sentences.cn: 微波能量可以使其分子随之运动。

sentences.en: Much interested and agitated, Mr. Lorry said:'You come from Doctor Manette?'
sentences.cn: 罗瑞先生很感兴趣,也很激动.罗瑞先生说: “ 你是曼内特先生打发来的 么 ? ”

sentences.en: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentences.cn: 她突然变得激动狂躁，四处乱跳还大喊大叫。

sentences.en: She was much agitated by the bad news.
sentences.cn: 坏消息使她的心绪很乱.
苏珊似乎因为什么事而烦躁不安。

sentences.en: The man in the house was in a very excited and agitated state.
sentences.cn: 房子里的那名男子情绪非常激动且焦灼不安。

sentences.en: The students agitated for the removal of a certain teacher.
sentences.cn: 学生们鼓动要更换某教员.

sentences.en: With the memory of the bombing fresh in her mind, Eleanor became increasingly agitated.
sentences.cn: 对轰炸记忆犹新的埃莉诺变得越来越焦躁不安。

words.tran_cn: 搅拌的，搅动的；不安的；鼓动的
宣传鼓动；宣传鼓动员（等于agitpropist）；宣传鼓动部门
搅动；煽动；使焦虑（agitate的现在分词）

trans.tran_cn: 不安的，激动的，颤抖的，（问题等）争论不休的
trans.tran_en: so nervous or upset that you are unable to keep still or think calmly

trans.tran_cn: 搅动（ agitate的过去式和过去分词 ），激怒，使焦虑不安，（尤指为法律、社会状况的改变而）激烈争论
